intro: Eugenia spicata, commonly known as the spike heather, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, spherical fruits that are typically red or purple when mature. Eugenia spicata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
